item.name: MySQL - Slave Exec_Master_Log_Pos
item.description: he position in the current master binary log file to which the SQL thread has read and executed, marking the start of the next transaction or event to be processed.

item.name: MySQL - Slave Last_SQL_Errno
item.description: The error number and error message of the most recent error that caused the SQL thread to stop. An error number of 0 and message of the empty string mean “no error.” If the Last_SQL_Error value is not empty, the error values also appear in the slave's error log.

item.name: MySQL - Slave Last_SQL_Error
item.description: The error number and error message of the most recent error that caused the SQL thread to stop. An error number of 0 and message of the empty string mean “no error.” If the Last_SQL_Error value is not empty, the error values also appear in the slave's error log.

item.name: MySQL - Slave Master_Host
item.description: The master host that the slave is connected to.

item.name: MySQL - Slave Master_Log_File
item.description: The name of the master binary log file from which the I/O thread is currently reading.

item.name: MySQL - Slave Master_Port
item.description: The port used to connect to the master.

item.name: MySQL - Slave Master_User
item.description: The user name of the account used to connect to the master.

item.name: MySQL - Slave Read_Master_Log_Pos
item.description: The position in the current master binary log file up to which the I/O thread has read.

item.name: MySQL - Slave Relay_Log_File
item.description: The name of the relay log file from which the SQL thread is currently reading and executing.

item.name: MySQL - Slave Relay_Log_Pos
item.description: The position in the current relay log file up to which the SQL thread has read and executed.

item.name: MySQL - Slave Relay_Log_Space
item.description: The total combined size of all existing relay log files.

item.name: MySQL - Slave Relay_Master_Log_File
item.description: The name of the master binary log file containing the most recent event executed by the SQL thread.

item.name: MySQL - Slave Seconds_Behind_Master
item.description: This field is an indication of how “late” the slave is: 1. When the slave is actively processing updates, this field shows the difference between the current timestamp on the slave and the original timestamp logged on the master for the event currently being processed on the slave. 2. When no event is currently being processed on the slave, this value is 0.

item.name: MySQL - Slave Skip_Counter
item.description: The current value of the sql_slave_skip_counter system variable.

item.name: MySQL - Slave IO Running
item.description: Whether the I/O thread is started and has connected successfully to the master. Internally, the state of this thread is represented by one of the following three values: 1. MYSQL_SLAVE_NOT_RUN. The slave I/O thread is not running. For this state, Slave_IO_Running is No. 2. MYSQL_SLAVE_RUN_NOT_CONNECT. The slave I/O thread is running, but is not connected to a replication master. For this state, Slave_IO_Running is Connecting. 3. MYSQL_SLAVE_RUN_CONNECT. The slave I/O thread is running, and is connected to a replication master. For this state, Slave_IO_Running is Yes.

item.name: MySQL - Slave_SQL_Running
item.description: Whether the SQL thread is started.

trigger.name: MySQL Replication - can not connect to database
MySQL Replication is connecting to master
MySQL Replication is slow on {HOSTNAME}
trigger.description: Replication is slow : - check server disk IO - check server CPU and Load Average
